medical_history.chief_complaint: Ongoing epigastric/back and right flank pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced epigastric pain radiating to the right flank and back for several weeks. The pain is not associated with movement or foot and has led to weakness. Symptoms include nausea, vomiting, cough, chest pain, and shortness of breath. The patient feels bloated and swollen. Previously evaluated and attributed to muscle spasm/strain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: DM2 poorly controlled with retinopathy, CKD with nephrotic syndrome due to diabetic nephropathy, hypertension, depression, atypical chest pain, and generalized anxiety disorder.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was recently evicted from her house and is staying in a shelter.
